title: Suicide Update!
body:
I have been playing this game for a really long time now, and I just don't understand why this hasn't been changed yet. Is suiciding really that frowned upon?
A successful suicide should be rewarded if anything, as it takes skill to do properly. Why do I have to ruin my permanent k/d/a or lose my item/champion stacks simply because I outplayed the enemy and died to a turret, not giving the enemy any gold?

Who thinks suicides should not give a death/lose of stacks?

replies.body: no. silly idea.. also if you manage to be executed your reward is not giving the enemy gold for killing you.
imo if you get exe to a tower you should get a 50% death timer reduction or something
It's a little bit of a guess how long it's been since you've taken damage. It would make for bad gameplay unless they added an execution timer or something.
suicides are very underrated, explicitly long term

I get where you are coming from, in a purely skill based battle as let's say EZ and you manage to hit all your Q and W shots, now just as you dive you hit your ult followed by your Q/W and an E that just dodges them, but you die to the turret. Yes you should be rewarded for killing them with that skill level.

Now, looking at the flip side, let's say you have 100 health left and the enemy is going B, but they also have 100 health, in the right situation you know you can flash in and get a free kill and not give any reward to the enemy, should you also be rewarded for this? Yes of course, but you already do, your reward is the death of the enemy, more gold for you and possibly more gold for your team also, plus you get the reward of not dying to the enemy and giving them a kill.

You need to look at the reward as more than just "Don't let me lose stacks", but think outside the square, by not dying to the enemy means you are not rewarding them with a kill and while you lose stacks you need to weigh up the situation, is it better to get the kill or keep your stacks?
